svg.style: font-family: 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; background-color: white; text-rendering: optimizeLegibility; -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;

text.tspan: Literacy rates, adult male, one-sentence test (DHS) vs self-reports
DHS literacy rates are defined as the percentage of survey respondents, aged 15 and above, who can read a whole or part of a
sentence showed. UNESCO literacy rates correspond to the percentage of people, aged 15 and above, who say they can read
and write with understanding a short simple statement about their everyday life.
Literacy rate, adult male (% of males ages 15 and above) - UNESCO
Literacy rate, adult male (% of total respondents) - DHS surveys
